;;From June 25 to September 30 this year, the Party Committee of the Ministry of Public Security Based on the characteristics of public security and the security and stability situation, we coordinated and directed the public security organs across the country to mobilize all police officers and go all out to carry out a summer public security crackdown and rectification operation to crack down on various illegal crimes and severely rectify outstanding public security problems, referred to as "Summer Operation". ;

;;

;

;;Ministry of Public Security: 2,317 suspects in northern Myanmar arrested for crimes involving China;

;

;Ministry of Public Security" Yin Chunji, deputy director of the Office of Summer Operation and deputy director of the Public Security Administration, said at a press conference held on the 10th that the Ministry of Public Security insisted on opening the way during the "Summer Operation" and formed a severe and high-pressure situation. ;

;According to the Ministry of Public Security, under the command and deployment of the Yunnan Provincial Public Security Department, the Pu'er Public Security Bureau further expanded its results. 209 telecommunications network fraud suspects were successfully handed over to us on October 1. At the same time, Lincang Public Security Bureau's border police law enforcement cooperation has made significant progress. The relevant local law enforcement departments in Myanmar handed over 497 telecommunications network fraud suspects to us in two batches on September 25 and October 7 respectively. This is another important breakthrough made by the Yunnan public security agencies in border police cooperation, following the Xishuangbanna and Puer public security agencies.

;

;At present, relevant criminal suspects have been detained by public security organs in Inner Mongolia, Heilongjiang, Zhejiang, Anhui, Fujian, Henan, Chongqing and other places involved in the case. After continuous and effective crackdowns, ;2,317 suspects of telecommunications network fraud in northern Myanmar have been successfully captured and handed over to us,;;including 23 behind-the-scenes “financiers”, organizational leaders and backbones. , there are 94 people at large online, which has effectively squeezed the living space of overseas fraudsters. Recently, the number of telecommunications network fraud cases across the country has shown a clear downward trend.

;

;;During the "Summer Operation", the Ministry of Public Security solved a total of 566,000 criminal cases;

;

;Yin Chunji introduced at the press conference that during the operation, the Ministry of Public Security solved a total of 566,000 criminal cases. There were 566,000 criminal cases, 2.042 million public security cases were investigated and handled, and 975,000 suspected criminals were arrested; 2.846 million conflicts and disputes were resolved, and 865,000 hidden security risks were eliminated; the 110 criminal and public security police reports nationwide decreased by 13.8% year-on-year respectively. , 5.2%. ;

;;Ministry of Public Security: 38 gang-related organizations have been beaten since "Operation Summer"! ;

;

;Zheng Xiang, deputy director of the "Summer Operation" Office of the Ministry of Public Security and deputy director of the Criminal Investigation Bureau, introduced at a press conference held on the 10th that public security agencies in various places have deepened the normalization of crackdowns on gangs and evil. Since the "Summer Operation", a total of 38 gang-related organizations, 430 evil groups, and 286 evil gangs have been eliminated, and 8,146 criminal suspects have been captured. Among them, the "fish that slipped through the net" was captured. 348 fugitives.

;

;Zheng Xiang said that all localities accurately grasp the characteristics of summer crime patterns and insist on "quickly, accurately and ruthlessly" cracking down on all kinds of illegal and criminal activities such as provoking troubles, gatherings to fight, intentional injury, robbery and robbery, and digging deep into the underworld. ;

;;Since the "Summer Operation", the Ministry of Public Security has recovered 683 missing and abducted women and children;

;

;Zheng Xiang said at a press conference held on the 10th, With a "zero-tolerance" attitude, public security agencies in various places have carried out in-depth special operations to crack down on crimes of trafficking in women and children, crimes of sexual assault, and crimes of medical insurance fraud. Since "Operation Summer", 212 criminal suspects suspected of abducting and trafficking women and children have been captured, and 683 missing abducted women and children have been recovered; 16,000 criminal suspects suspected of committing sexual assault have been captured; and criminal suspects suspected of committing medical insurance fraud have been captured 1,657 people were recruited and 83 criminal gangs were eliminated, effectively deterring crime.

;

;;Since 2021, Ruby Lin has As a producer, he rode the wave of the revival of Taiwanese dramas and launched many popular dramas: the female entrepreneurship drama "The Story of Their Entrepreneurship", the suspense-style female group drama "The First Light of the Night", and the The large-scale crime suspense drama "Copycat", and she achieved a reputation reversal with these popular dramas.

;

;In the Douban short review section of the latest Taiwanese drama "In This Lifetime", everyone also gave unanimous praise - "I am willing to pay Ruby Lin to make 100 films a year." "Ruby Ruby's production is a guarantee of quality. ”

;

;;While affirming the quality of the series, she also affirmed her vision as a producer. ;

;

;;

;

;;

;

;;The Taiwanese drama "Once Upon a Time" scored a high score of 8.8 after its premiere. It is one of the most popular Chinese dramas in recent times.

;

;;;

;;It brings together the backbone of the Taiwanese film and television industry: director Xu Zhaoren, who has directed dramas such as "Love Knot Chitose's First Love", "Skyscraper" and "Love Is Delicious"; screenwriter Du Zhengzhe is Ruby Lin's The gold medal partners have worked together in "16 Summers" and "The Lights Are Coming" and won the Golden Bell Award; in terms of actors, there are young actors like Wu Kangren, Zheng Yuanchang, and Zhang Rongrong, as well as veteran actors like Xixiang and Yang Guimei. ;

;

;;For countless audiences who have watched the film, the story of "In This Life Time" is no stranger. It is similar to the movie "A Man Called Ove Decides to Die" 》Similarly, it also relies on the idea of ​​​​"suicide". Introduced from the perspective of the male protagonist, it peels away the ordinary daily life, pays attention to the close connection between people, and then draws the conclusion that this connection is both a dilemma and a harbor.

;

;;;

;;The 41-year-old male protagonist Gao Jiayue (played by Wu Kangren) is a "loser" in the secular sense. When he was young, he took NT$1 million given by his mother to open a restaurant in a foreign country. However, the business failed and the restaurant was on the verge of bankruptcy. At the same time, his girlfriend of 12 years also openly cheated on her and became pregnant with someone else's child. A third party came not only to destroy the store, but also to "rob" his life.

;

;Gao Jiayue parted ways with his girlfriend, but he still couldn’t figure out what his problem was. His girlfriend mocked him: “You will never understand what I’m talking about in this life, but you can consider reincarnation, maybe in the next life. You will understand."

;

;;

;

;;These words from his girlfriend stimulated Gao Jiayue's thoughts of committing suicide. He attempted suicide several times without success. Then he decided to dive into the depths of the sea, unplug his oxygen tank, throw away his equipment, and wait for death. ;

;

;;But when he was floating alone on the sea, he suddenly thought of his family. This gave him the idea of ​​saying goodbye. ;So, after being away from home for more than ten years, he returned home again and reconnected with his family and the world as an "uninvited guest". ;;

;

;;

;

;;The title of the drama "In My Lifetime" is actually the name of Gao Jiayue's suicide note: it was originally named "Suicide Note", but he crossed it out; it was changed to "The Long Farewell" Finally, he crossed it out again; he was afraid that the "suicide note" was too heavy and the "farewell" was too sad. After repeated evaluation;;, he finally wrote this line - "It is not bad to grow up to this size in my lifetime." Now.";

;

;;

;It's just that in "The Story of a Common Girl", the plight of middle-aged women is directly addressed. The heroine has a clear understanding of her own life dilemma and will speak out without any scruples. Cry loudly. The portrayal of the male protagonist's situation in "In This Lifetime" is much more restrained, which is more in line with the impression of "a man will not shed tears easily". ;

;

;;

;

;;Gao Jiayue is the eldest son of the family. When he returned home, he found that everyone in the family was not living as he wished and was going through their own tribulations in life. ;

;

;;My parents have a cold relationship and have been sleeping in separate rooms for many years. My father was cheating on the little nurse in the hospital, and my mother knew it, but for the sake of face, she could only tolerate it. ;

;

;;Because he is an adopted son, the second brother Gao Jiayang consciously assumes more support obligations, but he is very tired because of the elders and children. At the same time, he also tries to get in touch with his biological children. parents. ;

;

;;

;

;;The third brother Gao Jiakai does not have a formal job, so he works in his parents' breakfast shop. He obviously has a girlfriend, but he is secretive and dare not let his family know. ;

;

;;My nephew Gao Chengyou is in his adolescence. He is worried about online dating and causing trouble on campus. ;

;

;;

;

;;The arrival of Gao Jiayue is like a fuse, causing family conflicts to break out. He tried hard to please his family, but he always accidentally made the atmosphere at home extremely awkward. ;

;

;;But even so, the family's concern still flowed silently into Gao Jiayue's heart. He came home drunk without saying hello. After going crazy, he passed out on the sofa. His father stayed with him all night. ;

;

;;

;

;;There was already a rift between the parents, but in order to make room for Gao Jiayue, they still lived together again. ;

;

;;The second brother was lukewarm towards Gao Jiayue. Seeing him doing nothing after returning home, he couldn't help but beat him: "You are still chewing on the old at this age, don't you think Is your life a failure?" However, in order to make his eldest brother sleep more comfortably, he took the initiative to buy a mattress for his eldest brother. ;

;

;;Even the nephew Gao Chengyou cares about Gao Jiayue in his own way. Gao Chengyou accidentally saw Gao Jiayue's suicide note, but instead of revealing his uncle's secret, he introduced his "online girlfriend" to his uncle, hoping to satisfy Gao Jiayue's wish to "have a good relationship." ;

;

;;

;

;;As a family drama about the flow of life;, the biggest feature of "Lifetime" is that it firmly grasps the word "life" and captures the warmth in the short stories of the parents. Feeling the sorrow and joy of ordinary people while stumbling. As netizens said, "This is not a drama, this is a documentary."

;

;My nephew Gao Chengyou's friend encountered ;school violence at school and committed suicide by jumping off a building. As a middle school student, Gao Chengyou was more helpless. His most "deviant" move was that with the help of Gao Jiayue, he occupied the school radio room and sang in memory of his friends. ;

;

;;

;

;;In terms of shooting techniques;, the play uses a large number of long shots to express family relationships in space, of which two are the most impressive.

;

;One scene is the night Gao Jiayue arrived home and came in drunk. The camera followed him and brought out the relationships and personalities of the Gao family through the process of him embracing his family.

;

;In another place, the next night the three brothers of the Gao family celebrated their father's birthday. In a slightly cramped space, Gao's mother was comforting Gao Chengyou who had been scolded, while the second brother was blaming;Gao Jiayue, weird He led his son to fool around on campus, while Gao Jiayue retorted absentmindedly and poured vinegar into the pot by mistake for soy sauce...;

;

;;For more than twenty seconds The picture condenses the family's exciting evening stories and family ties, making people feel that this is a real Fujian family. ;

;

;;

;

;; "In This Lifetime" has a total of 12 episodes. The frequency of weekly updates and the soothing plot may prevent it from becoming a big hit. But for lovers of slice-of-life dramas, it's palatable enough. ;

;

;;This kind of plain and freehand flow of life allows people to relieve their impetuous minds, accept the unsatisfactory life, and feel its warm and healing moments. ;

;

;Recently I saw a saying, "Grow slower and die faster." It may sound a bit confusing at first, but in fact it explains the truth of life very clearly.

;

;To put it simply, a person should try his best to age slowly, keep his mind young, live a quality and glorious life, and once he faces death and there is no way to recover, he should have a good time. , be optimistic about life, and don’t go against objective laws and make meaningless “struggles”.

;

;A friend talked about an incident. An old man had entered the last moments of his life, and a relative with whom he had a very good relationship was out of town. The old man’s children considered letting them see each other for the last time, so they prepared to use the ultimate method to Medical means extend the life of the old man and let him "wait" for his arrival. He considered and refused again and again, on the grounds that it would add unnecessary pain to the old man before he died. Even if it "makes sense" to him, it's not humane.

;

;Everyone is afraid of the word "old". Many people are desperately looking for beauty treatments, no matter how much money they spend, they are not afraid of getting old. There are also many people who are obviously old, but they are taboo about being called "aunt" or "uncle". But physical aging is an objective law that no one can resist. "Are you young? It doesn't matter, you will be old in two years." Zhang Ailing's famous saying fully expresses the impact of the law of aging on the illusion of "eternal youth".

;

;"Old" can be divided into two situations. One is that the body ages and the body functions become weaker. The original straight back has collapsed, the original beautiful features have turned into a "mess", the original speedy steps have turned into slowly moving steps with a cane... The second is psychological or spiritual aging. Some people have a good mentality and appear young, even if they are seventy or eighty years old, they are not old. Some people age faster than their peers under heavy pressure. The so-called "a 30-year-old has a 60-year-old heart" and "premature aging" all have this meaning. The latter type of people is actually more common. Their hallmark is that they want to work hard on the "Hot Wheels" every day, and they also frown and sigh all day long, accompanied by white hair and wrinkled faces.

;

;For those who are not involved in childbirth and are pampered, it is relatively easy to achieve the goal of aging slower. Even at different stages of a person, there are big differences. For example, the "Sha Wujing" who was leisurely swimming in the Liusha River back then must be more beautiful than the Sha Wujing who was walking on the road to seek Buddhist scriptures, eating and sleeping in the open and carrying everyone's luggage on his shoulders. Appear youthful.

;

;Most people cannot have freedom of wealth, nor can they rely on others to support themselves without working. This will inevitably lead to people plotting for rice and trying their best to get tomorrow’s steamed buns. Because in reality, it is not easy to make a living, and there are all kinds of internal and external frictions all the time, so there are nine out of ten people who are exhausted both mentally and physically.

;

;What to do? As ordinary people, since we cannot change our situation, the only thing we can do is to take it lightly.

;

;I once had a neighbor who was in his nineties and could ride a bicycle very fast. Why? In fact, he was not strong when he was young. Instead, he had problems here and there, but he just had a good mentality. Whether you encounter a small trouble or encounter a hurdle that others may think is almost insurmountable, you should be able to deal with it calmly, think less, and worry less. Such people should live longer. "Be heartless and live a long life" may not sound good, but the words are rough and rational, and the mentality of "if you can afford it, let it go" is worth learning.

;

;A person should work hard when working, and should also "try hard" to rest when resting. That is, he should neither be distracted when he should be working, always thinking about lying down, nor should he be lying down when he should be working. I always think about work when I am resting, and as a result, my work is not good and my rest is not good either.

;

;You can enter the world and you can emerge from it. This is the highest state of life. It seems difficult to achieve, but it is not. How to work and how to rest is a science. As an individual, you must learn to adjust, relax the tight strings at the right time, balance work with rest, and laugh at gains and losses. This is a skill that can be mastered. If you can't do it the first time, do it again.

;

;People are afraid of old age and even talk about death.

;

;Speaking of "die faster", this does not conform to the philosophy of many Chinese people. In contrast, it is greed for life and fear of death. Even if you die a moment later, it seems to be good. This is instinctive and understandable.

;

;In order to die slowly, many people (mainly family members of the deceased) do whatever they can to survive. As long as they can breathe one more breath in the human world, they are willing to suffer all kinds of hardships. This mentality has far-reaching influence. Most of the savings of many people's lives are not spent while enjoying life and raising children, but are thrown into the water in a "surprise attack" one or two months before death. Death is already an irreversible outcome. No matter how much money is spent, it is in vain. At most, it can delay the death a little. In the end, one person will lose both his life and property, and even his children and grandchildren will be burdened with heavy debts. It is really not worth it.

;

;In the face of disease, some people are even "scared to death". As soon as they heard that they had an incurable disease, they would fall into a state of panic and disorder, causing physical and mental harm and exacerbating physical diseases.

;

;The most difficult thing in life is to remain transparent on the subject of death. If a slower death equals long-term torture—including torture for children—then the meaning of life will also change.

;

;My father told me that there was an old lady in the family who lived alone and lived to a ripe old age. She had done "white things" during her lifetime, and she became a favorite story in the village. If a person has seen through life and death, and the true meaning of "disappearance", what is there to be afraid of, and why must he do it even though he knows it cannot be done?

;

;To let go of life calmly is a kind of great love. It’s not about going against the trend and forcibly delaying death, it’s about cherishing life. Knowing the deadline, waving your hands and going away, isn’t it a kind of optimism towards life?

;

;Of course, there is no need to doubt the significance of saving lives and healing the wounded. Reducing illness and pain in life is a legitimate pursuit. But what we need to take warning from is gambling-like “fighting” in order to die slowly.

;

;There are reports that after someone learned that he had terminal cancer, he specifically told his closest relatives not to needless treatment, let alone to "intubate" himself when he was dying, so as not to spend more money. . Having such an open heart is a rational choice after insight. Of course, financial hardship is also one of the reasons, but in general, it is still based on optimism about life and great love for family.

;

;To grow old slowly and die quickly is my creed and pursuit.

;

;;•;;（ This article is only the author's personal opinion and does not represent the position of this newspaper);

;Song Dong's work "You Are There". Standing below and looking up, I appear in the mirror, caught in a fishing net, with age symbols on the left and right. This is where different eras, regions and myself meet ; (Liu Lang/Photo) ;

;

;"Look, everyone, this is the 'Big Egg Powder' that has become very popular recently -" A teacher-looking person pointed to the exhibit behind him with one hand and held up a microphone with the other, speaking to the person in front of him. said a dozen young people. They were wearing uniform white short T-shirts. It was probably a summer vacation activity organized by a nearby school. On August 29, 2023, the second GDMoA Annual Artist Academic Nomination Exhibition was launched at the Guangdong Museum of Art and will last until October 8. The works of the 21 nominated artists are displayed in several exhibition halls on two floors. They are rich in types and styles, attracting a steady stream of visitors. For several consecutive weekends, the admission quota for 1,000 people every half day has been reserved early, and there is a long queue at the entrance of the Guangdong Museum of Art. When the crowds are the strongest, it takes an hour to queue to enter.

;

;The most photographed exhibit on social media in this exhibition is the "big egg powder" in front of these students. It was made by artist Feng Yu using bamboo curtains and wooden frames, and is called "Wei". The work is introduced as "an exploration of ancient space emotions, and also an extreme mechanical challenge to traditional Chinese soft materials." The bamboo curtains and wooden frames are curled and twisted to form several looping and twisting pipes, occupying nearly half of the venue, standing tall and full to the left and right. The promotion speech written by Zhang Zikang, director of the Central Academy of Fine Arts Art Museum, described it this way, "The artist uses the relaxing combination of the movement rhythm of Chinese calligraphy to form a unique spatial scale experience and emotional experience. Every viewer will have a different feeling when entering it."

;

;;

;

;Feng Yu’s work "Wei" is called "Dan San" on social media and is widely circulated;(Liu Lang/ Picture);

;

;Judging from the feedback, in the audience’s feelings, it has derived an image that is more suitable for the Internet context - Dansan. Egg powder is a traditional snack in Guangdong. It is made of flour, gluten flour, eggs and lard, fried in a wok until light yellow, scooped up and dipped in maltose before eating. In Cantonese, Dan San also refers to a timid or unpromising little person, taking his characteristic of being "not strong enough". The color of the bamboo curtain and wooden frame is very similar to the light yellow color of the eggs when they come out of the pot, and the irregular bends are like the appearance of the eggs on the plate. Compared with the words in the recommendation, "This spatial art installation will no longer be retained as the exhibition closes. Just like fireworks and life, no matter how gorgeous and bright they are, they will eventually pass away with the wind...", it is obvious that "the eggs are scattered" Closer to young people’s daily experience.

;

;A work that is also highly visible on the Internet is the artist Song Dong's "You", which is very Cantonese from its name - "无" comes from Cantonese, pronounced mǎo, meaning nothing, This word was first seen in "Guangdong Tongzhi" revised by Huang Zuo during the reign of Emperor Shizong of the Ming Dynasty. From the perspective of word creation, the word "无" is the provincial meaning of the word "有". Song Dong, who was born and raised in Beijing, has a close connection with Guangdong. His works were included in the first Guangzhou Art Biennale as early as 1992.

;

;In 2017, Guangzhou Fei Art Museum invited Song Dong to hold a solo exhibition. He walked around the vegetable market next to the art museum for a long time and thought that the smoky-looking vegetable market should not be separated from the tall Class A office buildings and private art museums next door. Can you make an unbounded wall? So, he built a 106-meter wall made of old windows. It was made of glass and walls. Various exhibitions could be held inside. The name of the work was "Wall without Borders".

;

;The art museum invites residents from surrounding communities to put in small items that they are reluctant to throw away at home, including Teresa Teng’s audio tapes, thermos bottles with double happiness printed on them, and even BB cameras. During the launch, the museum held a long street banquet. Everyone gathered around the 106-meter wall and chatted while eating Poon Choi: "Where is the boundary between life and art?"

;

;In "Have You", Song Dong continued his previous style. A rectangular fishing net is pulled out on the second floor of the art museum, and it is covered with about 200 old mirrors. They have different shapes, but they have a unified sense of age. On the back of the mirror are yellowed figure paintings, calendar scenery, and various block letters. words, or clean and old brown wooden boards. When you stand under the work and look up, you will see yourself in the mirror, caught in a fishing net, with age symbols on the left and right. This is where different eras, regions and yourself come together.

;

;Song Dong wrote: "The title of "You" uses the local characters of Guangdong, expressing the juxtaposition of the words 'have' and 'no' to form the title. I have always believed that nothing is the ultimate The big being is the great nothing. The mirror is not only an indispensable object in life, but also a philosophical object for thinking and understanding. I have been asking 'what is a mirror' for a long time, and I think 'everything is Mirror', the mirror divides the world into real and virtual, existence and non-existence. It also integrates real and virtual, existence and non-existence into one place. It is the critical interface between 'being' and 'empty'. I use a big net to catch The collected mirrors form a 'diaphragm', dividing the space into virtual and real worlds. These mirrors have seen different people and objects, and they are constantly refreshed and vacated. As the saying goes: everything is a mirror body and place. , catching all emptiness and nothingness in one sweep."

;

;This thinking text received another interpretation from the students. After they stared at the "Egg Powder" for a few minutes, the teacher asked: "Do you want to go in and have a look? The original intention of this artwork is to hope that the audience can walk among it, interact with the work, feel the changes in the space, and have different emotional experiences." . Do you think so?" After receiving a unanimous nod, she said with a smile: "But now it's blocked and you can't get in. Let's just close our eyes, imagine, and pretend we're walking through it. Come on, let's start. ——"

;

;They really closed their eyes and entered a kind of existence and non-being.

;A kind of turbulence The infectious disease is spreading among the reindeer in Aoxiang.

;

;On the morning of July 18, 2023, veterinarian Lao Ge received a notice from the village that four reindeer had died in a row at a tourist spot, and he had to go check what was going on.

;

;Aoxiang, the full name is Aoluguya Ewenki National Township. Driving 250 kilometers northeast from Hailar, the central city of Hulunbuir, Inner Mongolia, is Genhe, the county-level city where Aoxiang is located. It borders Mohe, the northernmost part of China, and is the "China Cold Pole" certified by ;National Climate Center; ”——The annual average temperature is minus 5.3 degrees Celsius, and the heating period is 9 months.

;

;

;The Ewenki are one of the ethnic groups with a small population in China. According to statistics from the seventh census, there are 34,617 people in this ethnic group.

;

;Historically, there were three tribes of the Ewenki people. Among them, the safari Yakuts are called the "deer tribe" because they raise reindeer. They are the smallest micro-group within the tribe and the only ethnic group that raises reindeer in China.

;

;Rudolph the Red-Nosed, who pulls Santa’s sleigh, is the star among the reindeer. This is an animal that lives in the tundra around the Arctic Circle. Its two towering antlers are more than one meter long and have many branches like tree branches.

;Historically, the Ewenki were divided into three tribes: Solon, Tungus and Yakut, each engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry and hunting. In 1957, after ethnic identification, these three tribes were collectively called the Ewenki.

;

;Lv Guangtian, an ethnology scholar at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, has verified that as early as 2000 BC, the ancestors of the Evenki people lived on the shores of Transbaikal and Lake Baikal. In the 17th and 18th centuries, the Shilu Ewenki people (hereinafter the Ewenki people are specifically referred to as the "Shilu tribe") came to the Greater Khingan Mountains on the right bank of the Ergun River, the border river between China and Russia, and never left.

;

;"People living in the mountains and forests" began to descend from the mountains after the founding of New China. At that time, the Ewenki people were hunting on the right bank of the Ergun River.

;

;In 1957, the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region approved the establishment of Qigan Ewenki National Township. Since then, allowing the Evenki people to settle has become a goal that the party committee and government hope to achieve. After the government built the wooden house (a typical Russian dwelling made of wood and mud), the Ewenki people had a place to settle for the first time. However, although they have a home at the foot of the mountain, except for the township head and the director of the supply and marketing cooperative who live there all year round, the rest of them live in a state of settlement and hunting. They hunt in the mountains for a long time and occasionally live at the foot of the mountain.

;

;In 1965, the Ewenki settlement moved eastward from Qigan to a place 17 kilometers north of Mangui Town.

;

;Kong Fanzhi, who once served as deputy director of the Standing Committee of the People's Congress of Genhe City, is a researcher of Ewenki culture. ;

;That is the original and real Aoxiang, so named because it is surrounded by the Aoluguya River. In the Ewenki language, "Aoluguya" means a place with lush poplar trees.

;

;In order to distinguish it from Aoxiang after the relocation in 2003, the settlement chosen at that time was habitually called "Old Aoxiang". For the Ewenki people, the period after the relocation was their "golden years." Schools, grain depots, post offices, hospitals, cultural stations and banks were built where 126 Evenki people originally lived. In order to develop the economy, the township has also set up wood processing plants, hunting production teams and ethnic trading companies. Foreigners also came. At its peak, there were more than 500 people living in Lao Ao.

;

;Kong Fanzhi recalled that in Lao Ao Township, the Ewenki people were considered "nobles". Maria Suo's family became the first 10,000-yuan household in the township in the 1980s. ;The young Evenki people have their own way of survival.

;

;36-year-old Gu Musen has 300,000 fans on the short video platform. In 2022, he founded his own media company, signed up young people in the countryside to be "artists", and attracted tourists by relying on the fans he accumulated on the Internet.

;

;Some people who went to big cities to make a living have also returned. After graduating from college, Jue Le originally worked as an administrator in a hospital in Beijing, bought a house, got married, and had children in Beijing. But he felt that the work in the hospital was boring, and staying in the cubicle "was like turning on the mechanical mode." In 2016, Juele returned to Genhe and ran a tourist spot not far from Aoxiang. "It was very open, just like playing."

;

;Doing tourism business in Aoxiang can indeed bring considerable income. Juele estimates that he will earn more than 100,000 yuan from tourism in the summer of 2023, which will be enough to support his family throughout the winter.

;

;Bai Lan gave He Xie some advice. The couple was humorous in their dealings with others, and He Xie played the harmonica well. If they could clean up their house and start a small business in the tourism industry, they could make money. He Xie was not willing to do it and thought it was "boring".

;

;He Xie still maintains a rough drinking method: drink vigorously for a few days to get stronger, then sleep for a few days and nights, wake up, then get up and continue drinking.

;

;Lao Lie, who was once envied by others, has become a person who is left behind and "has not made progress" in the eyes of his relatives.

;

;At the end of July 2023, He Xie returned to Lao Ao Township. Not long after the Ewenki people moved out, the land was acquired by a real estate businessman in Daqing with plans to develop an international hunting ground. As a result, the plan was aborted, the hunting ground was not built, and all the old wooden carving houses were demolished.

;

;Old Aoxiang became a deserted land, and the weeds on the roadside grew as tall as half a person. He Xie walked around Lao Aoxiang with his hands behind his back, but he didn't recognize where his house was.

;

;A fellow traveler asked him if he would be willing to come back to raise deer again. He thought about it seriously. This place had been uninhabited for a long time, and there were more wolves and lynxes nearby. "It might not be appropriate to come back again."

;

;;;"Romanticism" and "Realism";;

;

;As National Day approaches, a brown bear has become the big news in Aoxiang . At around 5 o'clock in the morning on September 26, 2023, Lao Ge received a call that a bear had entered the reindeer park - he entered through the ticket gate, and he was familiar with the road. This is the third time it has visited the deer park in half a month.  

;

;Lao Ge joked, "If it comes again, then we will have to deal with it." When it comes to the beasts that appear more and more frequently, the deer herder on the mountain doesn't sound so relaxed.

;

;In 2021, a brown bear visited Yang Lan’s deer spot and killed 7 reindeer in one night. In another household, after the arrival of the wolves, only 8 of the more than 30 reindeer were left. In the year when the beasts were most serious, the entire Aoxiang lost more than 200 reindeer, and the total number of reindeer was more than 1,300. In other words, one out of every six reindeer died due to beasts.

;

;Really annoyed, Yang Lan's father complained to her that if the guns could be returned to the hunters for a week, the problem of animal harm could be solved. Otherwise, in a few years, deer farmers will face personal danger even if they survive in the mountains.  

;

;Both the speaker and the listener know that this is just angry talk. They are all nationally protected animals, who would dare to fight them?

;

;The Ewenki people are also gradually losing their ability to survive in the mountains and forests, which makes Bai Lan feel a little anxious. How to choose between modernity and tradition? "Everything has given Ewenki an external intervention, so this culture will inevitably have its flaws." Bai Lan put forward this point of view in an interview with the media at the beginning of the ecological migration in 2003.

;

;She felt that if hunters could decide their own development model, obtain certain resource management and use rights in ethnic areas, and be able to engage in moderate logging and hunting, the situation might be different.

;

;“That’s the view of literati.” In 2003, Kong Fanzhi had a remote debate with Bai Lan. When he mentioned it again now, he still couldn't agree with Bai Lan's point of view. "We can't just let the Ewenki people live in Zuoluozi in order to protect traditional culture, right? Who doesn't want to live a modern life?"

;

;In Xie Yuanyuan's view, these two attitudes come from completely different things. value judgement.

;

;During the research, she and Maria Saw lived in Deer Point for more than half a month. Get up at around five o'clock in the morning and work, such as beating legba, milking deer, picking wild fruits, cooking leather, and sewing leather goods... The days are simple and repetitive, and no one thinks that life needs any changes.

;

;Of course, Ewenki people of different ages have different pursuits. When younger hunters see the broader world, they will naturally feel that their nation's customs are backward and want to make changes.

;

;Xie Yuanyuan also wrote at the end of her doctoral thesis that traditional hunters who are attached to forest life do not have the right to speak and cannot easily sacrifice things that are more valuable and meaningful to the long-term development of mankind."

; p>;

;Twenty years later, doctoral student Xie Yuanyuan became a researcher at the National Institute of Strategic Studies at Tsinghua University. Today, in her opinion, Bai Lan’s views are “romantic”, while Kong Fanzhi represents the “realist”.

;

;It is inevitable for social development for micro groups to enter modernization. Now Xie Yuanyuan feels that from the perspective of national governance, this is a sacrifice that must be made for the development of the nation. Faced with reality, rational The attitude is to remember those people and give them and their descendants a certain amount of compensation. "This is reality."

;

;In fact, since the Ewenki people first settled and came into contact with the outside world, Some traditions are slowly changing.

;

;The Ewenki language has no written characters and can only be passed down orally from generation to generation. Even people as old as He Xie and Lao Ge cannot speak the Evenki language as well as Half of them are old people. The birch bark boat, the most commonly used means of transportation by the Ewenki people half a century ago, has long since drifted into the museum from the rivers of the Greater Khingan Mountains. When Lao Ge was young, he began to tie several rubber tires together to use as a boat. , much simpler than making a birch bark boat.

;

;Since the Ewenki hunters first settled in 1957, the young people who are now returning home to raise deer and run the tourism industry are already the third generation since the settlement. .

;

;"What about the next generation? " Bai Lan feels that the third generation who grew up in the mountains and forests have some affection for reindeer. The fourth generation of children who are not yet adults have lived on the cement floor since they were young. "What will reindeer be in the future? Maybe I don’t care anymore.”

;

;Kong Fanzhi believes that the reindeer will not disappear in Aoxiang. It is now the most important symbol of the Ewenki people and the reason why tourists rush to Aoxiang. “Others Nothing more to say."

;;

;

;Cai E's posthumous photo. ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;On November 8, 1916, Cai E died of illness in Fukuoka Hospital, Japan, leaving behind five children. According to his wife Liu Xiazhen, Zhulian is 10 years old and Fulian is 8 years old. According to his wife Pan Huiying, Shulian is 4 years old, Duansheng is 2 years old and Yongning is less than one year old. Cai E neglected his personal interests and became depressed after his death. His last words "didn't say anything about family affairs", leaving him no time to consider the upbringing and education of his children after his death. Fortunately, teachers and friends such as Liang Qichao, Tan Yankai, and Xiong Xiling planned the orphan education on their behalf. The friendship was touching, but the process was quite tortuous.

;

;;

;

;Cai E's family portrait published in "Oriental Magazine". ;;

;

;;Cai Gong Orphan Education Association;

;

;In early February 1917, the Hunan Provincial Government Approved the establishment of the Cai Gong Orphans Education Association, and announced the association's seven rules and staff list:

;

;;This association will be the foundation for planning. It is his duty to manage the upbringing of Cai Gong's orphans. (2) The association publicly recommends a number of reviewers to perform the following duties: planning orphan education policies; raising, keeping and distributing orphan education fees; and appointing directors. (3) The Association presumes that the following directors are entrusted by all members to perform their duties: Education Director, who is responsible for supervising the implementation of orphan education, reviewing subjects, selecting schools, inspecting academic performance, etc.; Accounting Director in Hunan, Responsible for the safekeeping of education fees in Hunan; Accounting Director in Shanghai, responsible for the custody of education fees in Shanghai. (4) Each director must report the performance of his duties to the reviewers once every six months. If there are any obstacles in the progress, all reviewers will be asked to solve the problem. (5) The comments of the reviewers shall be made by correspondence. (6) Any director who resigns will be reviewed and re-recommended by all the reviewers. (7) Once the orphan reaches adulthood, the association shall be revoked by unanimous resolution of the council members. ;

;

;;Reviewers: Liang Qichao, Xiong Xiling, Tan Yankai, Fan Yuanlian, Jiang Fangzhen, Zhang Xiaozhun, Shi Taojun, Zeng Jiwu, Fan Zhihuan . ;

;

;Liang Qichao was the founder of Cai Gong’s Orphans Education Association. The month after Cai E’s death, he drafted the rules of the association and sought the consent of relevant personnel. Shi Taojun submitted the case to the nearby Hunan Provincial Government. Liang Qichao drafted a speech that was full of reasoning and reasoning: "Therefore, the general served as an official in Yunnan and Guangxi, and served in Kyoto for more than ten years. At times, he was worried about state affairs, and did not care about family finances. In the breeze, his sleeves were full of energy, and he engraved this The white hair is in the hall, the yellow mouth is in the arms, and all the aftermath matters are waiting to be dealt with. Maybe they have been in trouble all the time, or they may have been close friends. They are saddened by the death of the hero, and the orphans are helpless. They gather their colleagues and organize the Cai Gong Orphans Education Association. . Regarding matters related to the upbringing of orphans, our Association should carefully plan and cooperate with us at all times to provide support for the future. We should ensure that we are able to serve the country well in the future, have no worries at home, and comfort the souls of heroes underground." The Hunan Provincial Government has already participated in the matter. Chief Tan Yankai immediately gave instructions for filing, and ordered Xiangjiang Daoyin and the governors of Changsha and Baoqing counties to check and take the records.

;

;;

;

;Records about the Cai E Orphans Education Association in "Tan Yankai's Diary". ;;

;

;Liang Qichao put a lot of thought into the design of the Cai Gong Orphans Education Association. Its goals and tasks, division of responsibilities and operation methods are all clear and feasible. As early as early December 1916, Xiong Xiling proposed: "The current situation is unpredictable. To raise money for Song Gong's bereaved family, it seems appropriate to quickly send calls to the central government and all provinces for help." He also asked Liang Qichao to lead the call. Through contact with Cai E's family in Shanghai, Liang Qichao discovered that "their family affairs were extremely controversial," so he decided to initiate the establishment of the Cai E's Orphans Education Association to reduce the impact of family conflicts on the education of orphans. Instead of using electricity to raise donations, so as not to violate Cai E's "honest intentions during his lifetime," he instead mobilized relatives and friends to donate money, and planned to subsidize it with royalties. The people invited were selected by Liang Qichao, and were either Cai E's mentors or colleagues from the same hometown. Xiong Xiling, Tan Yankai, Fan Yuanlian, Zhao Hengti, and Jiang Fangzhen were also important figures who influenced Hunan Province and even the country. There are separate accounting directors in Hunan and Shanghai. One is to facilitate current education, and the other is to facilitate future study abroad, taking long-term and comprehensive considerations into account. In addition, two sources of fundraising are planned: one is national pension, and the other is sponsorship by comrades and martyrs at home and abroad; three methods of maintaining and increasing the value of donations: one is to purchase real estate, the other is to invest in valuable public stocks, and the third is to save in banks . Liang Qichao's design was unanimously approved by Tan Yankai, Xiong Xiling and others, who believed that it was "allowed to be called Xiexie".

;

;On April 17, 1917, Tan Yankai came to the Cai Gongying Funeral Office located in the Changsha Army Surveying and Mapping Bureau to attend a meeting of the Cai Gong Orphans Education Association. This is the first actual operation of the Cai Gong Orphans Education Association. Zhang Xiaozhun, Shi Taojun, Zeng Jiwu, Fan Zhihuan, Xiao Kun, Yuan Jiapu, Zhao Hengti, Liu Gengxian, Chen Fuchu, He Pengxiang, Tang Xi, Yue Sen, etc. in Hunan have a high probability of joining the Cai E family. Attended a meeting together. After the meeting, Tan Yankai telegraphed the agreed opinions of the meeting to Xiong Xiling and solicited his opinions:

;

;;Xiao Ri (Editor's note: on the 17th) The Cai Gong Orphans Educational Association held a meeting and decided on the following matters: 1. The property in Shanmen shall be retained by the Dowager. 2. The newly purchased houses and land in the provincial capital and Baoqing City are owned by brothers Duansheng (i.e. Cai Duan, author's note). 3. The new and old movable properties, except for the 10,000 yuan provided for the meal expenses of the dowager, the rest of the stocks and cash will belong to the Duansheng brothers. 4. According to Cai Gong’s order during his lifetime, Duansheng will be raised by his wife, and Yongning will be raised by his wife. All movable and immovable properties will be equally divided and cannot be sold. 5. Investigate old accounts and clear them separately. 6. Madam, if your wife is currently living together and separated, should you do that?;

;

;The distribution plan is centered on brothers Cai Duan and Cai Yongning, which has the color of the era where men are superior to women. Shanmen's local property is located in Shanmen Town, Wugang County (now part of Dongkou County) where the Cai family lived. It consists of a field with an annual rent of ten stones and an old house. Two new real estate properties were purchased in the provincial capital and Baoqing City. One is the residence at No. 1 Zhangshu Garden, Swan Pond, outside the south gate of Changsha City, which is relatively small in scale; the other is the abandoned site of the old association in Baoqing City, which was built by Cai E after his death. Tang Qian came forward to purchase it and originally planned to build a nursing home for Cai's mother, but the construction had not yet started due to lack of funds. The bulk of the property was the shares of Hunan Huachang Mining Company, which were very popular at the time, totaling 34,000 yuan, of which 5,000 yuan was purchased by Liang Huankui three years ago as a gift in gratitude to Cai E for his hard work and lack of production. At that time, the monthly salary of the brigade commander was as high as 2,000 silver dollars, and the total property of the Cai family did not exceed 40,000 yuan. Compared with local officials of the same era, they were really shabby. The sixth article, "Mrs. Ru, Mrs. Ru is currently living together and separated" confirms that "their family affairs are extremely controversial", which obviously puts Tan Yankai in a bit of trouble. This telegram is found in "Mr. Xiong Xiling's Posthumous Manuscript" and should have been sent to Liang Qichao and others at the same time, but others have not preserved it.

;

;;Pay attention to descendants to repay the old friends;

;

;After the victory of the National Defense Movement, wars still continued, social unrest and people's livelihood were difficult, and the Cai family was also greatly affected. Affected by the international situation and other factors, the price of pure antimony dropped sharply. After a short period of prosperity, Hunan Huachang Mining Company fell into trouble in 1918 and later went bankrupt. Company managers such as Yang Du and Xiong Xiling have also been subject to continued lawsuits and extortion by Americans, and have even been detained. The Cai family's important asset, 34,000 yuan worth of shares in Hunan Huachang Mining Company, was lost in less than two years after collecting interest. Affected by war and disasters, the Cai family almost lost revenue from land and house rent. The world is difficult, and colleagues in the association have suffered greatly, but they still take the responsibility of caring for and supporting Cai E's orphan at heart.

;

;On February 19, 1921, Tan Yankai, who was in the Guangdong military government, wrote to Shi Taojun: "We must not ignore Mr. Cai's orphan. There are too few people here, and I am afraid that the inquiry is not as good as ours. My brother calls me my generation. It would be good to work out a solution, and everyone will agree. I hope you will tell me what you think." This was Tan Yankai's reply to Shi Taojun. Facing the plight of the Cai family's financial resources drying up, Shi Taojun asked Tan Yankai to find a way to rescue him, hoping to find a way to rescue him in Guangdong. Although Tan Yankai could not think of a permanent solution to the new approach, his sense of responsibility and concern were palpable. Four years later, Shi Taojun's son Shi Chaobai and Cai Zhulian got married in Shanghai, and then studied in Japan together, which was also an apology to their hometown friends.

;

;;

;

;The "News" report on Cai E's Orphans Correctional Association on February 17, 1917. ;;

;

;At the end of May 1922, Liang Qichao called Zhao Hengti, the governor of the Hunan Provincial Government, asking him to care for Cai E's orphan and protect the Cai family's property. The text is as follows:

;

;;Dear Sir, Qi Chao met with Bingsan and Jingsheng a few days ago, and occasionally asked about Cai’s posthumous affairs and education. The problem is that we should pay special attention to the incident. As for the property purchased by the bereaved family, since it is the capital of Cai Gong, we have to think of some preventive methods. The savings of the Cai Gong Orphans Correctional Association are very small, so they can only set aside funds for education, and it is extremely difficult to use them for other purposes. The living problems of the surviving family members cannot but focus on the property that has been established. Unless there is an official effort to consolidate the preservation of this property, it is difficult to guarantee that it will not be eroded or abused by local ruffians. Members of the association should fulfill their own responsibility for maintaining and supervising the association, so those who respect the descendants of meritorious deeds are repaying their deceased friends. I hereby write to the deacon to promptly issue a notice and order it to be handed over to the local government office where Cai Gong’s property is located, prohibiting the sale and mortgage of the property, so as to protect the property and its long-term prosperity. The words of public friendship are dedicated to this, and I praise Xun'an. Liang Qichao also started. ;

;

;Zhao Hengti was once convicted of rebelling against Yuan, but was rescued by Cai E. He was very grateful. He was also a member of the Cai Gong Orphans Correctional Association, and immediately ordered the governor of Baoqing, where the Cai family was from, to comply. Zhang Xiaoyu, let everyone know. It can also be seen that Liang Qichao, Xiong Xiling, Fan Yuanlian and others have never forgotten Cai E and the orphans of the Cai family, and often tried hard to protect them.

;

;In early 1927, with the development of the Northern Expedition and popular movements, Hunan Province's movement to recover concessions, regain consular jurisdiction, anti-warlords, and punish old bureaucrats and gentry gained unprecedented momentum. The provincial government successively promulgated the "Hunan Province Provisional Provisions on Punishing Local Bullies and Evil Gentlemen" Regulations" and the "Interim Regulations of Hunan Province on Punishing Corrupt Officials", a special court and a committee to investigate and investigate counterfeit goods were established, and the campaign of sealing and confiscating counterfeit goods spread throughout the province. The Provincial Inspection and Inspection Office will reward those who report illegal property. The reward for reporting movable property will be 20% of the confiscated amount, and the reward for reporting immovable property will be 5% of the confiscated amount. Groups such as the Provincial Federation of Trade Unions have actively promoted it, using members' meetings and other means to distribute questionnaires on adverse labor on a large scale, and strongly encourage reporting of adverse labor. There is a sizable property under Tang Guo's name, located at No. 31, Dadongmao Lane, Changsha City. It has been declared a reverse production and is about to be confiscated as the office building of the Provincial Mining Union. Three days later, the Cai Duan brothers contacted all walks of life to the effect that although the property was built by the Tang family, all rights had been transferred to the Cai family and should be returned. Immediately, under the intervention of military dignitary Tang Shengzhi and others, the property was removed from the list of adverse births. Tang Qian (1875-1929), courtesy name, was born in Baoqing. He joined the Tongmenghui while studying in Japan. After returning to China in 1905, he successively served as the director of the Guangxi Army Academy and the Yunnan Lecture Hall. Later, he participated in the Revolution of 1911 and the National Defense Movement. He has always been with Cai E and regarded him as a brother. He was one of the attachés who escorted Cai E to Japan for medical treatment. After that, Tang Xi served as the Financial Secretary of the Hunan Provincial Government, the President of the Provincial State Council, and the Director of the Provincial Finance Bureau. He was an important member of the provincial governor Zhao Hengti, and also served as the Director of the Ministry of Finance of the Beiyang Government. The warlord Zhao Hengti and the Beiyang government were both wanted to overthrow the Hunan Province at that time. Because of this relationship, the industries under Tang Guan's name were included in the anti-production list. Two years later, Tang Guan died in Shanghai, and his family donated the property to the Renshu Hospital next door in accordance with his last wish. It can be seen that the Cai Duan brothers provided friendly assistance to the Tang family by providing electricity, and it was society's respect for Cai E's orphan that preserved the Tang family's property. Before and after this, Cai E's second brother, Song Yuan, privately used his property as a mortgage to borrow money and deliberately went into bad debts. Cai E's wife, Liu Xiazhen, came forward to report that he had been defrauded and reported the case to the police station. It was immediately exposed by the other party and a public statement was made in the newspaper. However, it was only published for three days and then stopped. There was also the intervention of important people behind the scenes to protect Cai E's family.

;

;In the past ten years, Liang Qichao has expanded his influence by advocating state funerals, regular commemorations, organizing Songpa Library, and writing birthday poems for Cai E's mother to take care of Cai E's orphan, who was still at home one or two years before his death. The book mentions: "Cai Songpo's family is hungry and now they are homeless in Shanghai." Naturally, they can't help but try to save them. When Jiang Fangzhen was in Changsha, he lived in Cai E's house.

;

;In the past ten years, Zhang Xiaozhun, Fan Yuanlian, Liang Qichao, Tang Xiang, and Tan Yankai have passed away one after another, but colleagues in the Cai Gong Orphans Correctional Association and even outsiders have never given up helping Cai E's orphans. The friendship is touching. In June 1931, upon the petition of Zhang Renjie and others, the National Government allocated an annual pension of 800 yuan to Cai E's survivors, a monthly education fee of 400 yuan for their children, and a subsidy of 5,000 yuan for building a temple. Cai E's daughter was mentally depressed and was recuperating in Mogan Mountain, so Jiu Buqu heard the news and donated money to help reduce the pressure on medical expenses. On May 2, 1935, Mrs. Cai's mother Wang passed away in Changsha. Dignitaries from all walks of life sent letters of condolences and presented expensive gifts. The Hunan provincial government organized a grand funeral. The reputation of the Cai family reached its highest level after Cai E's state funeral. point. Around 1950, under the arrangement of Zhu De, Cai Duan and Cai Yongning entered the North China People's Revolutionary University to study, and were subsequently assigned jobs.

;

;;A little regret and accident;

;

;There are very few public historical materials about Cai E's orphan's growth and development. According to general reports, except for Cai Fulian, who died young, both men and two women were college graduates. Cai Duan studied in the History Department of Fu Jen Catholic University in Peking, Cai Yongning studied in the History Department of Southwest Associated University, Cai Shulian studied in the Department of Pests and Diseases of Zhejiang University, and Cai Zhulian also studied abroad Japan. According to the "History of Peking Fu Jen Catholic University", Cai Duan entered the History Department of Peking Fu Jen Catholic University in 1934. In 1935, he participated in the December 9 and December 16 anti-Japanese demonstrations and was injured, which shows that he was quite heroic as a young man. Peking Fu Jen Catholic University is a church-run university with excellent teachers and equipment. However, the tuition is expensive, about 400 yuan per academic year, and ordinary families cannot afford it. The care and concern of the Cai E Orphans Correctional Association and the righteous people have ensured that the living and educational standards of the four people are higher than ordinary people.

;

;After graduation, Cai Duan worked in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the National Government. After the founding of New China, he worked in the Cultural and Historical Materials Research Committee of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference and Guangming Daily. Cai Yongning worked in Yunnan Fudian Bank and Beijing Institute of Physical Education. Cai Shulian teaches at Songpo Middle School in Kunming, Yunnan. All four of them received good higher education and obtained decent jobs after entering the society. It can be said that they have basically become adults.

;

;In the second half of 1946, General Lei Biao, a fellow countryman of Cai E's hometown, published a long article "A Brief Story of Mr. Cai Songpo" in the "National Defense Monthly", recalling Cai E's achievements and character in detail with deep affection, and even sighed at the end of the article. Angry:

;

;;However, the family situation after his death is also deeply sighing. As a general, The family has no place to stand, the old mother is in the house, the two younger brothers have not completed their studies, the widow has a young son, and the upbringing is helpless. Although Liang was appointed as a public teacher, he collected 10,000 to 20,000 gold from various parties' tributes, just for the temporary needs of the family, and as a citizen. In the 90s and 10s, the war between the north and the south resumed, and Baoqing, where he was originally from, was particularly affected. His mother, wife, concubines, and children had no peace at home all year round, and they had no choice but to live in Yunnan, Beijing, etc., and all their savings were exhausted. , it is also very surprising that the most shameful ones are the ones who have benefited the most, and those who have taken charge of the donations collected by all parties to support orphans, no less than tens of thousands of yuan, have been swallowed up together. Unexpectedly, in the army protecting the country, there are actually like this Such a person. ;

;

;In the first half of 1905, Cai E served as the assistant director of the Hunan Coaching Office and a teacher at the Hunan Military Preparation School and the Bingmu School. Lei Biao was a student at the Bingmu School and followed Cai E after graduating in June of that year. E went to Guangxi, then to Yunnan and Sichuan, participated in the Revolution of 1911 and the National Defense Movement, and has been holding important military positions. When Cai E left Sichuan, he told Lei Biao to control an army and support the provincial governor Dai Kan. Because he was far away in Sichuan and probably not familiar with Liang Qichao, he did not participate in the Cai E Orphans Education Association. As a fellow villager, student, and subordinate of Cai E, what Lei Biao said should be basically credible based on his identity and experience.

;

;Many colleagues from Cai E’s Orphans Correctional Association have joined the National Defense Army. Among them, Shi Taojun, Zeng Jiwu, Xiao Kun, Liu Gengxian, He Pengxiang, Tang Guan, and Yue Sen are Baoqing compatriots who have more contacts with Cai E. He Pengxiang and Tang Gu were Cai E's deputy chief and secretary respectively. Theoretically, these people could be the person Lei Biao mentioned. As for people outside the association, it's hard to guess. However, people at the time generally believed that Shi Taojun and Cai E had a long and frequent relationship, and later became in-laws of their children, with the two families having the closest relationship. Li Xiaodan's "Farewell Biography of Cai E" pointed out: "His classmate Shi Taojun was the broker of his family affairs." Therefore, it is very possible that Lei Biao alluded to Shi Taojun. Of course, all this is just speculation, and the truth needs to be proven by new historical data.

;

;It is a great pity that such a collective act of charity is mixed with the selfish misdeeds of individuals.

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 10:25:13 +0800 小学生写字用左手还是右手，是个问题吗？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258319
;;2023-10-10 09:00:00;
;

;My son went to elementary school this year. When I signed up, I saw that it was full of people; when I went to the classroom, I saw that it was full of people. It's crowded. There were originally 40 people per class, but now it's almost 60. But what troubled my wife and me at first was whether the child should write with his left hand or with his right hand.

;

;My son is left-handed, which is a minority. According to statistics, one in ten people is left-handed. There are many left-handers in our family. My mother, wife, and eldest daughter are all left-handed. According to this statistics, the majority of them reaches 60%. When my son followed me to write calligraphy and draw pictures, many people around me were surprised and said: "Left hand!" My wife and I are relatively consistent on this point and have never let him forcefully use his right hand. Therefore, when others are surprised, I will say to my son: Son, you can write in whichever hand you want. Dad will not force you.

;

;My son is very casual when he learns to write from me. But when I entered first grade, the problem of writing first surfaced again, as if it was back to when my eldest daughter was more than ten years ago. Because my daughter’s left hand writing was forcibly changed by her elementary school teacher, but she was not used to it at first, and then she changed to writing with her right hand. The left hand still took priority in doing other things, but the left hand could no longer write. Looking back on my daughter's experience of changing her right hand to write, the only difference is that when writing numbers and letters, there is a mirror image. Sometimes it is easy to make mistakes like b and d, but she gradually got used to it. For my son, I talked with the kindergarten teacher when he first started drawing with colored pens, and he has always used his left hand.

;

;Because of the problem of left and right hands, I have checked a lot of information, but there are almost no accurate and scientifically verified answers. Is this a question to be studied or a pseudo-question that is not a question? It is worth thinking about.

;

;After searching on the Internet, many celebrities including Einstein and Bill Gates are left-handed. They are far away from us. The most famous one I know is Gao Fenghan, a Qing Dynasty painter and one of the Eight Eccentrics of Jiangnan. He has hundreds of square meters of exhibition area dedicated to his works in the Qingdao Museum. He is a famous writer who writes with his left hand, but I don't know if he is left-handed because he only used his left hand after his right hand became ill. The other is the local Nobel Prize winner Mo Yan. I often see him writing with his left hand, but I don’t know if he is left-handed, let alone whether his most famous works were inspired by his left hand or his right hand. Assuming that both of them are right-handed, there will be no problem writing with the right hand, and the left-handed person will naturally use the left hand. Of course, there will be no problem.

;

;We live in a world where the right hand is used to writing, eating and doing things. Because the number of people is small, people are a little curious about people who do things with the left hand. From this perspective, the question of writing with the left hand or with the right hand is a social phenomenon, an indicator of social tolerance. When you are a minority, the only problem may be that you have to grow up in a different light, which is not easy. Although it is not easy, I still tend to let it take its course when it comes to my son's left hand writing. With a symmetrical human body structure, it is impossible to say which side has the advantage. Therefore, it is especially important to treat left-handers as normally and naturally as right-handers.

;

;I used to think that this issue would attract many parents to discuss it enthusiastically, but when I posted it in the class group, I got no response. After the first parent-teacher meeting in elementary school, I communicated with my child’s class teacher, and the answer I got surprised me: In my son’s class, among the 55 children, there was only one left-handed person who wrote. Of course, he was not the only one who was left-handed. I asked friends of all ages who are familiar with me, and the information I got was: a fourth-grade primary school student said that there was only one student in his class who wrote with his left hand; a second-grade primary school student said that there was no one in his class who wrote with his left hand; a third-grade primary school student said The head teacher told me that in her impression, among the many classes she taught, there was only one child who wrote with his left hand. It seems that the question of whether we use our left hand or our right hand has been entangled for a long time. For most people, it is not a problem at all, and of course there is no need to discuss it. Perhaps, parents had made a choice about this issue when they first started holding pens in kindergarten, or they may have struggled with it at that time, but most people chose the mainstream, that is, using their right hand.

;

;Children who are born left-handed are destined to be a minority among the crowd, and it seems that children who choose to write with their left hand can only be a minority among the minority in our small place. If you look at it from another angle, writing naturally with the hand that is most convenient for you is not a problem if you are left-handed and right-handed. But from the perspective of only looking at the left and right, especially the perspective that more people only look at the right hand, becoming a minority is indeed a challenge.

;

;If a son chooses to write with his right hand, it will be a challenge. It will challenge his physical limits. This is an individual issue; but choosing the left hand and choosing the minority is a psychological and social challenge. Children, although you are in the minority, hold on!

;

;(The author is a citizen of Gaomi, Shandong)

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 09:25:13 +0800 卫星照片机械执法，晒谷场边的几棵树被砍了http://www.infzm.com/contents/258291
;;2023-10-10 08:00:00;
;

;Not long ago, I went back to my hometown for some time for some reason. One day, I received a call from the village cadre saying that several trees next to his own grain drying field outside the village needed to be cut down.

;

;These are some poplar trees that my father planted next to the grain drying farm more than ten years ago. Although they were planted at the same time, several trees grew unevenly. The largest one was more than 30 centimeters in diameter at breast height and I couldn't wrap my arms around it, while the smallest one was no more than the width of a bowl. My mother said that maybe they were planted too densely, and the weaker ones couldn't compete with the stronger ones, so they grew slower and slower.

;

;After chatting with the village cadres for a while, I learned that cutting down trees was required by the superiors. This time, in addition to a few trees in my house, all the trees planted by villagers in nearby fields will be cut down: "This time, all these trees in the fields south of the road must be cut down, and there is no bargaining." It is said that the County Land and Resources Bureau received satellite photos ("satellite photos") sent by superiors, which circled many places in our county and said that these are cultivated lands, and those with trees must be cut down, and those with greenhouses must be demolished. All the land was restored to cultivated land.

;

;Ordinarily, our trees grow beside the grain drying field and are not planted in the ground. Strictly speaking, the grain drying farm is agricultural facility land, not farmland. How did this small grain drying field with only a few dozen square meters turn into cultivated land? Maybe it’s because my parents have been in poor health in recent years and have farmed a lot less land. This drying field has basically not been used. It is covered with grass in summer, so it is regarded as cultivated land in the satellite film? Or maybe those who watched the satellite films didn't make a careful distinction at all, but just drew a random picture and concluded that all the land south of a certain road was cultivated land, and if it was changed to other uses, it would be restored?

;

;In fact, such problems are not uncommon in the process of "satellite film law enforcement". More than half a month ago, a doctoral student from the School of Social Sciences of Wuhan University also mentioned a similar issue in an article. The superior land and resources department determines land use based on the changes in the "patterns" of satellite photos over the past few years. If it is found that the original cultivated land has turned into forests or houses have been built, it will issue a notice asking the local government to "enforce the law" and return the land to farming. But the problem is that the use of some land is more complicated and has changed many times in history. Just looking at satellite images without carefully studying the nature of the land and its changes can easily lead to problems.

;

;And due to the insufficient resolution of the satellite images used in land surveys in previous years, some relatively small roads and other construction lands were not identified and were all classified as cultivated land. Nowadays, with technology upgrades, satellite photos The resolution has been greatly improved, and the road in the middle of the farmland could be distinguished. However, it turned out that it was considered illegal to occupy land for road construction and needed to be rectified. Just like my family's grain-drying field, it was also zoned as cultivated land, and the trees planted next to it had to be cut down. These mechanical "law enforcement" that do not study the actual situation and only look at pictures on satellite films, the pressure is directly transmitted to the grassroots, and conflicts between cadres and farmers are commonplace.

;

;In our county, due to the reduction of rural population and lack of labor force, a lot of land cannot be cultivated. Moreover, most of the land in our village is hilly and sloping, and it is difficult to divert water for irrigation. We basically rely on the sky for food, and the harvest from farming is not high. For farmers, switching to planting trees may not bring much income from selling trees, but at least they don’t have to work hard every year. A few years ago, the government also encouraged afforestation and even provided subsidies for planting trees, so some villages also planted trees on their farmland. Nowadays, it is necessary to "return forests to farmland" and cut down all the trees that are just about to become useful. This will naturally harm the interests of farmers and cause many people to not understand.

;

;Of course, there are indeed some good lands, and it is a pity to plant trees. For example, the neighboring village has thousands of acres of flat land beside a small river. There is water in the river. It was the "irrigated land" that everyone envied back then, and it was very suitable for growing wheat and corn. Later, these lands were also planted with trees. When I passed by my hometown a few years ago, I felt quite emotional. These patches of cultivated land have good soil quality and water for irrigating, and large agricultural machinery can be used to reduce manpower. Perhaps after the cultivated land is restored, it can be collectively contracted to large households for growing food through circulation.

;

;As for the barren mountainous land in our village, even if it is converted back to cultivated land, there will be no one in the village who can cultivate it. After all, the more than 200 people who still stay in the village all year round are mostly six-year-olds. For a seventy-year-old man, these fragmented lands are difficult to carry out large-scale mechanized farming. Even if all the trees are cut down, the final result is likely to be abandoned. So what’s the point of cutting down trees and “still plowing”? Will we spend money to hire people to grow food in the future?

;

;However, although there are doubts, the old people in the village are relatively honest, and most of them will not delve into it. If it says it needs to be cut, then just do it. After all, cutting down trees is now the task of the village cadres, and many of the villagers are related to the village cadres, or at least they are neighbors who never see each other without looking up. The villagers do not want to make it too difficult for them. It's not worth breaking up for a few trees.

;

;In addition to the village cadres, there were also two businessmen from nearby villages who specialized in cutting down and buying trees. They negotiated the price on the spot, and they would come to cut down the trees and take them away the next day. There was no need to sell the trees in the whole process. People worry. However, since trees are being cut down everywhere now, the price is naturally much cheaper. A few years ago, someone offered 200 yuan to buy the largest tree, but my mother thought the price was too low and refused to sell it. Now, the five trees can only be sold for 200 yuan in total. This was because the person who bought the tree was an acquaintance from my mother’s natal village and was given a preferential price.
